Text.Value: All the more reason I ought to be looking after you.
So here I am, come to re-insert myself. After all, remember what happened last time I let you out of sight?
No matter, Mr Dekarios. Tara's here now, and she'll sort you out. But first, my payment.
And I decided 'will not'. And a good thing, too. You look like you haven't had a good meal in days.

EditorData.NodeContext: With mother hennish but irritated concern.

Text.Value: I looked away for a moment, just once, and look where it got us. You, a living doomsday device. The shame.

EditorData.NodeContext: (She says this with an undertone of affection).

EditorData.stateContext: Gale on his bedroll, unable to sleep

Text.Value: Of course, Mr Dekarios. What else are friends for?
I don't take orders from my masseuse. Eat up, now. And chat soon.
*You made yourself a walking cataclysm, the annihilation brewing within you just about held at bay by your constant consumption of magical objects. Tara saw it all, but never left your side.*
*Nestled amongst your books and papers, Tara bore witness to your greatest triumphs... and your greatest failure.*
*You'll need to drain magical energy from a powerful artefact soon. As you contemplate your hubris, your eyelids grow heavier and heavier...*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] Fade to black. Gale falls asleep.
EditorData.NodeContext: GAle falling asleep toward the end, can be stretched out a little

Text.Value: Speaking of which - I brought you something. For your tummy troubles.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Magic pocket - Tara teleport's an object into Gale's pocket.

Text.Value: It's good to see you, Tara. I've missed you very much.
And I you, of course. The tower just isn't the same without you stomping about in the background.
It is terribly good to see you, Mr Dekarios.
*Your mistakes have been huge. The consequences... memorable. But you won't let anyone die. You can't.*
*You imagine the explosion. Thousands will die. You have to stop it - ceremorphosis and the orb itself.*
Well, it isn't the Mother of All Magic, lucky for you. You look terrible. Are you eating?
You promised to stay in Waterdeep. 'Promise,' verb, meaning to swear something will or will not be done.
*A ring, coursing with magic. The netherese orb within you shudders, longing to consume, to devour... It must be satisfied.*
Now eat up! If you explode and kill us all, I'll be furious.
I'm not sure, Tara. It's dangerous out here.
Making sure you keep on the straight and narrow, as is my task in this weary life.
We have a great deal of catching up to do. Eat that, have a wash and, for the love of all that's dear, a shave. Then you can fill me in on what I've missed.
*You know exactly what this illithid parasite will do to you. Within seven days, you'll become a mind flayer.*
Ahhh, that's it. No one manages the nuances quite like you.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: She approaches Gale. He smiles,bends and scratches her around the neck. "Ahh, that's it..." At the end of the line, she returns to her neutral pose.

Text.Value: I know, I'm looking exceptionally well. You, on the other hand - how the tidy have fallen. Are you eating?
Goodness, I'd forgotten. Thank the gods you reminded me before I starved to death.
I have my doubts. But first things first...
*Sleep is a hazy oasis on the far side of a desert of worry.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Gale is lying restless on his bedroll, unable to sleep

Text.Value: I won't be teased, heckled, pestered, or vexed, Mr Dekarios. Not before I've had my due.
Dare I ask what you're doing here?
*You try to think of something else but it's no good.*
Anyway - incidentally - I was getting very bored without my friend.
Well, well, well. Look what the tressym dragged in.
Cast your mind elsewhere.
How did you find me?
You need to go home - now. And that's final.
Tara! Is that you?!
Wizards ask questions, they don't issue imperatives. You ought to know that by now, Mr Dekarios.
In fact, I think I feel as bad as I look.
Consider that it'll explode, flattening an area larger than Waterdeep.
Handy little spell I've been working on. 'Tara's Catflap of Displacement.' I haven't worked out all the kinks, but I'm starting to be able to find my way around.
Thank you, Tara. I really needed this.
Think of Mystra, goddess of magic.
I can look after myself, Tara.
Excuse me, Mr Dekarios. Mr Dekarios. Yoo-hoo!

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The dialogue opens to a black screen on a camp morning. We hear Tara's voice through the blackness.

Text.Value: *But what about the bomb in your chest? Ceremorphosis is likely to destabilise it. What then?*
Of course you do. You're still paying the price with that ticking time bomb in your gullet. Ugh, the indignity.
Destiny is at your door; won't you at least twitch the curtain?

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Gale] startles awake and jumps to his feet <TarikS>
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] Gale startles awake and jumps to his feet, revealing a winged cat perched on an object (stump? chair? whatever will help Tara be at Gale's eye-level while he's standing. The idea is that their dialogue will be cheap from here on out, i.e. Gale won't have to talk and emote while sitting or laying down, but standing in normal position).

Text.Value: Don't get used to it. You need to go back to Waterdeep. Now.
*She was furious when she realised what you'd done. Seeking control, trying to prove yourself her equal. You were in love with her. Now you're a danger to everyone you know.*
But I suppose your case is worse than I thought. All the more reason for me to stay and keep an eye on things. We wouldn't want you to make another apocalyptic mistake, would we?

Synopsis: Tara rejoins Gale, offering him a magic item and reminding him of his plight.
